alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 8:34PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Collier, northern Mainland Monroe and Miami-Dade Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 834 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Big Cypress National Preserve, or 20 miles east of Chokoloskee, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Loop Road Ee Center, Carnestown, Big Cypress National Preserve, Dade-Collier Training Airport and Copeland. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
